name: Kalmia latifolia
Relationship: Complementary: BENZ. ACID.Compare: Kalmia contains Arbutin g.v. DERRIS PINUTA (of great service in neuralgic headaches of rheumatic origin).Compare: SPIGELIA; PULSAT.
Modalities: Worse: leaning forward ; looking down; motion

Heart: Heart's action tumultuous, rapid and visible
Shooting through chest above heart into shoulder-blades
Gouty and rheumatic metastasis of heart
Dyspnoea and pressure from epigastrium toward the heart
Sharp pains take away the breath
Eyes: Stiff, drawing sensation when moving eyes
Scleritis, pain increased by moving the eye
Stomach: Bilious attacks, with nausea, vertigo, and headache
Pain in pit of stomach; worse by bending forward; relieved by sitting erect
Sensation of something being pressed under the epigastrium
Head: Confusion of brain
Vertigo; worse stooping
Pain in front and temporal region from head to nape and to teeth; from cardiac origin
Urine: Frequent, with sharp pains in lumbar region
Back: Pain from neck down arm; in upper three dorsal vertebrae extending to shoulder-blade
Pain down back, as if it would break; in localized regions of spine; through shoulders
Face: Stitches and tearing in bones of jaw and face
Sleep: Sleepless, wakes very early in morning
Female: Menses too early, or suppressed, with pain in limbs and back and inside of thighs
Extremities: Pains along ulnar nerve, index finger
Weakness, numbness, pricking, and sense of coldness in limbs
Pains affect a large part of a limb, or several joints, and pass through quickly
Pains from hips to knees and feet
Tingling and numbness of left arm

details: A rheumatic remedy. Pains shift rapidly. Nausea and slow pulse frequently accompanying. Has also a prominent action on the heart. In small doses, it accelerates the heart's action; in larger it moderates it greatly. Neuralgia; PAINS SHOOT DOWNWARDS, WITH NUMBNESS. FULGURATING PAINS OF LOCOMOTOR ATAXIA. Protracted and continuous FEVERS, with tympanites. Paralytic sensations; pains and achings in limbs accompany nearly every group of symptoms. ALBUMINURIA.
